data.title: Famous Deaths on November 5
data.meta_description: Famous deaths for the 5th of November. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals died throughout history on November 5.
data.text:
Casimir III the Great, King of Poland (1333-70), dies at 61

Mariotto Albertinelli, Italian painter, dies at 41

Kanō Motonobu, Japanese painter and calligrapher (Kanō school of painting), dies at 83

Irini Fedorovna, Russian daughter of Boris Godunov, dies

Alexandre de Rhodes, French Jesuit missionary (b. 1591)

1660 Lucy Hay, Countess of Carlisle, English socialite (b. 1599)

Johannes Cocceius, Dutch reformed theologist, dies at 66

Cort Adeler, Norwegian admiral and ship designer (served Dutch, Venetian and Danish navies), dies at 52

Gillis Valckenier, Regent and Mayor of Amsterdam (1665-79), dies at about 57

Charles Gerard, 2nd Earl of Macclesfield, French-born English politician, dies at about 40

Bernardino Ramazzini, Italian physician (founder of occupational medicine), dies at 81

Johan Willem, Duke of Ripperda, Dutch political adventurer (Prime Minister of Spain, 1726), dies at 55

Andreas Benedikt Praelisauer, German choirmaster and composer, dies at 44

Carl Andreas Duker, German classical scholar (b. 1670)

Hans Egede, Norwegian Lutheran missionary (b. 1686)

Johannes Schmidlin, Swiss composer, dies at 50

1772 Pieter Steyn, Dutch grand pensionary (1749-72), dies at 66

Motoori Norinaga, Japanese physician, scholar, and writer (Kojiki-den (Commentaries on the Kojiki)), dies at 71

Pierre Choderlos de Laclos, French army general and writer (Les Liaisons dangereuses (Dangerous Liaisons)), dies at 61

Betje Wolff [Elizabeth Wolff-Bekker], Dutch novelist and poet (Sara Burgerhart; Willem Levend), dies at 66

Angelica Kauffmann, Swiss Neoclassical painter, dies at 66

Dirk van den Boetzelaer, Regent of Holland, dies at 55

Maria Feodorovna of Russia, second wife of Tsar Paul I of Russia, dies at 69

Aernout Drost, Dutch literary/founder (The Guide), dies at 24

Karel Hynek Mácha, Czech poet (b. 1810)

Ferdinand Karl Joseph, Archduke of Austria-Este, dies at 69

Soimonov, Russian general, dies in battle of Inkermann

Carl Binder, Austrian composer, dies at 43

Otis Tufts, American machinist and inventor who built printing machines, steam engines, firefighting equipment and invented the steam pile driver, dies at 65

Thomas Sully, American portrait painter (Queen Victoria), dies at 89

James Clerk Maxwell

Scottish physicist (speed of light), dies of abdominal cancer at 48

Robert Woodward Barnwell, American Senator for US Senate and Confederacy, slave owner and planter, dies at 81

William Hicks, British col/commander (Egyptian army), dies in battle

Antoinette Brown Blackwell, American minister (1st ordained US female minister), dies at 96

Jacques d'Adelswärd-Fersen, French novelist (b. 1880)

Christiaan Eijkman

Dutch physician and bacteriologist (Nobel Prize in Medicine 1929), dies at 72

(Mary Louise) "Texas" Guinan, American vaudeville singer, silent film actress, and speakeasy (saloon) proprietor, dies of amoebic dysentery at 49

Karen Hulda Garborg, Norwegian playwright (Mot Solen), dies at 72

Mina Dilis-Beersmans, Flemish actress/wife of John Dilis, dies at 71

Jack McAuliffe, Irish-American boxer and undefeated World Lightweight champion (1886-93), dies at 71

Charles Barrois, French geologist and palaeontologist, dies at 88

Arndt Pekurinen, Finnish pacifist, executed without a trial for refusal to follow orders at 36

George M. Cohan

American father of musical comedy (Phantom President; Give My Regards to Broadway), dies of cancer at 64

Louis Schelfhout, Dutch painter and graphic artist, dies at 62

Alexis Carrel, French surgeon, sociologist and biologist (Nobel 1912), dies at 71

Joseph Stella, Italian-American Futurist painter (Brooklyn Bridge), dies at 69 [1]

1946 Zygmunt Stojowski, Polish-American concert pianist, composer, and pedagogue, dies at 76

Agrippina J Vaganova, Russian ballet dancer and pedagogue (Fundamentals of the Classical Dance), dies at 72

1951 Bedrich Antonin Wiedermann, Czech organist and composer, dies at 67

1951 Reggie Walker, South African athlete (Olympic gold 100m 1908), dies at 62

Oran "Hot Lips" Page, American jazz trumpeter, singer, and bandleader, dies at 46

Charley Toorop, Dutch painter (3 Generations), dies at 64

1955 Maurice Utrillo, French painter (Port St Martin, Montmartre), dies at 71

Art Tatum, American jazz pianist and composer, dies from complications of uremia at 47

August Gailit, Estonian writer (Ekke Moor), dies at 69

1960 Johnny Horton, American country and rockabilly singer ("The Battle of New Orleans"), dies in a car accident at 33

Mack Sennett

Canadian-American film director and producer (Keystone Kops), dies at 80

1960 Ward Bond, American actor (Wagon Train, It's a Wonderful Life), dies of a heart attack at 57

(Edwin) "Buddy" Cole, American jazz and session pianist, Hammond organist, orchestra leader, and composer ("Truth Or Consequences"), dies at 47

1964 Alexander Uriah Boskovich, Israeli composer, dies at 57

1964 Lansdale Sasscer, U.S. Congressman for Maryland's 5th District (b. 1893)

1964 Mabel Lucie Attwell, English children's author and illustrator, dies at 85

Dietrich von Choltitz, German general known as the "Saviour of Paris" for surrendering the city to Free French forces and disobeying Hitler's orders to destroy it, dies at 71

Robert Nighthawk [McCollum], American blues singer, electric slide guitarist, and harmonica player ("Annie Lee Blues"), dies of heart failure following a stroke at 57

Estelle Hemsley, American actress (Leech Woman, Take a Giant Step), dies at 81

1968 Robert Ayres, actor (Battle Beneath the Earth), dies at 54

Itih Walracen, Sudanese widow of author William Walraven, dies

1969 Lloyd Corrigan, American actor (Papa Dodger, The Manchurian Candidate), dies at 69

Sam Jones, American baseball pitcher (MLB All-Star 1955, 59; no-hitter 1955; Chicago Cubs), dies of neck cancer at 45

Reginald Owen, British actor (Mary Poppins, Sherlock Holmes), dies at 85

Stafford Repp, American actor (Playhouse 90, Batman, Plunder Road), dies of a heart attack at 56

Edward L Tatum, American molecular geneticist and biochemist (Nobel Prize 1958), dies of heart failure at 65

1975 Lionel Trilling, American literary critic and author (1969 Poses Award, The Liberal Imagination), dies at 70

(Jacob) "Jan" Garber, American violinist and sweet jazz bandleader, dies at 82

1977 Aleksey Stachanov, Russian model miner, dies at 72

René Goscinny

French cartoonist (Asterix), dies of cardiac arrest during a routine stress test at 51

1977 [Gaetano] Guy Lombardo, Canadian-American orchestra leader ("Auld Lang Syne"), dies of heart attack in Houston at 75

Denis O'Dea, Irish actor (Niagara, Esther & the King, Treasure Island), dies at 73

Al Capp, [Alfred Gerald Caplin], American cartoonist (Li'l Abner), dies at 70

1979 Amedeo Nazzari [Buffa], Italian actor (Nights of Cabiria; Chains; Caravaggio), dies from cardiac arrest at 71

Gerarda "Gerda" Brautigam, Dutch journalist and politician (PvdA), dies

1982 Theresa Hak Kyung Cha, American novelist (Dictee), raped and murdered at 31

Lloyd McBride, American labor leader (President of United Steelworkers), dies at 67 [1]

Arnold Chikobava, Georgian linguist (b. 1898)

(Ulysses) Bobby Nunn, American singer (The Robins; The Coasters - "Charlie Brown"; "Youngblood"), dies of a heart attack at 61

1986 Claude Jutra, Québécois actor and film director (b. 1930)

Eamonn Andrews, Television Presenter (b. 1922)

1987 Georges Franju, French film director (Judex; Les Yeux sans visage - Eyes Without A Face), dies at 75

1987 Jan Nicolaas Bakhuizen van den Brink, Dutch theologist and church historian, dies at 91

Barry Sadler, American singer ("Ballad Of The Green Berets"), dies from complications of being shot 14 months earlier at 49

1989 Vladimir Horowitz, Russian-American classical pianist (Variations on a Theme from Carmen), dies of a heart attack at 85

Bobby Scott, American composer, arranger and jazz singer ("He Ain't Heavy, He's My Brother"), dies of cancer at 53

1990 Herbert Berghof, Austrian actor (Belarus File, Harry and Tonto, Target), dies of heart failure at 81

1990 Humphrey Gibbs, Governor of Southern Rhodesia (1959-69), dies at 87

Fred MacMurray, American actor (Double Indemnity, The Apartment, My Three Sons), dies of pneumonia at 83

1991 Robert Maxwell, Czech-British billionaire publisher, politician and fraudster (Mirror Group, NY Daily News), drowns at sea at 68

Arpad Elo, Hungarian physicist (chess classification system), dies at 89

1992 Jan Hendrik Oort, Dutch astronomer (hypothesized "Oort Cloud"), dies at 92

Maurice Cranston, English philosopher and political scientist (John Locke biographies), dies at 73

McHenry Boatwright, American operatic singer (Clarence Cameron White's "Ouanga"; Dave Brubeck's "The Gates of Justice"), dies of cancerat 66

Laura Weber, American folk guitarist, educator, and public television host, dies at 70

Eddie Harris, American jazz saxophonist and composer ("Freedom Jazz Dance"), dies of congestive heart failure at 62

1996 Lars-Ake Nilsson, Swedish diplomat, dies at 53

1996 Paula Hinton, British ballet dancer, dies at 72

Epic Soundtracks [Kevin Paul Godfrey], British musician (Swell Maps, Crime and the City Solution, These Immortal Souls), dies in his sleep at 38

1997 Isaiah Berlin, Latvian-British philosopher, dies at 88

1997 James Robert Baker, American novelist, screenwriter (b. 1946)

Bibi Titi Mohammed, Tanzanian politician (b.1926)

2000 Jimmie Davis, American singer and songwriter ("You Are My Sunshine"), dies at 101

2000 Roger Peyrefitte, French writer (Special Friendships), dies at 93

2000 Victor Grinich, American businessman (b. 1924)

Barry Horne, a British animal liberation activist.

2001 Roy Boulting, English film director and producer (Desert Victory), dies at 87

Billy Guy [Frank Phillips], American baritone pop singer (The Coasters, 1955-73 - "Charlie Brown"; "Youngblood"), and record producer, dies of cardiovascular disease at 66

2002 Stan Burns, American television screenwriter (The Tonight Show, 1954-57; Get Smart; The Carol Burnet Show; The Flip Wilson Show; Dean Martin Roasts), dies of heart failure at 79

Vinnette Carroll

American actress and 1st African-American woman to direct on Broadway (1972: Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope), dies of heart disease and diabetes at 80

Bobby Hatfield, American singer (Righteous Brothers - "You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin'"), dies of acute cocaine toxicity at 63

(Fred Lincoln) "Link" Wray, Native American rock guitarist ("Rumble"), dies of heart failure at 76 [1]

2005 John Fowles, British novelist (Collector, French Lieutenant's Woman), dies at 79

2005 Rod Donald, New Zealand environmentalist (b. 1957)

2005 Virginia MacWatters, American soprano, dies at 93

Bülent Ecevit

four term Turkish Prime Minister (between 1974 and 2002), dies at 81

LaMar Clark, American boxer (record most consecutive knockouts 44, including unsanctioned bouts), dies at 71

Nils Liedholm, Swedish football midfielder and coach (b. 1922)

Michael Higgins, American actor (Angel Heart, 1918, Wanda, Black Stallion), dies of heart failure at 88

2008 Paul Greening, Royal Navy officer and master of Queen's household, dies at 80

Félix Luna, Argentine historian and lyricist, dies at 84

Adrian Păunescu, Romanian poet and politician (b. 1943)

2010 Jill Clayburgh, American actress (Unmarried Woman, Semi-Tough), dies of Leukemia at 66

2010 Shirley Verrett, American mezzo-soprano (Berlioz'z Les Troyens - "Cassabdra"; Verdi's MacBeth - "Lady MacBeth"), dies of heart failure at 79 [1]

Bhupen Hazarika, Indian singer, composer, lyricist, music director, and filmmaker, dies at 85

Charles V. Bush, African-American pioneer (1st African-American US Air Force Academy Graduate and US Supreme Court Page), dies from colon cancer at 72

2012 Elliott Carter, American composer, dies from natural causes at 103

2012 Stalking Cat [Dennis Avner], American body modifier, dies at 54

Lee Crystal [Sackett], American drummer (Joan Jett & The Blackhearts - "I Love Rock'n'Roll"), dies at 57

Lane Evans, American politician (Rep-D-IL, 1983-2007), dies at 63

Guido Masanetz, German composer (In Frisco ist der Teufel Los), dies at 101

Robert Knight, American pop singer ("Everlasting Love"), dies at 79

Ernest J. Gaines, African-American author (A Lesson Before Dying; The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman), dies at 86

Geoffrey Palmer, British actor (The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin, The Madness of King George, Butterflies), dies at 93 [1]

2020 Len Barry [Leonard Borisoff], American singer, songwriter and producer (The Dovells - "Bristol Stomp"; solo - "1-2-3"), dies of bone marrow cancer at 78

Charlie Burns, Canadian ice hockey forward (world champion Whitby Dunlops 1958) and coach (Minnesota North Stars), dies at 85

2021 Marília Mendonça, Brazilian Sertaneja singer-songwriter, dies in a plane crash at 26

2021 Roger Zatkoff, American football linebacker (Pro Bowl 1954, 55, 56; First Team All Pro 1954, 55; Green Bay Packers), dies at 90

2021 Russell Ebert, Australian Rules midfielder (4 x Magarey Medals; 6 x Port Adelaide FC B&F; Australian Football HOF) and coach (SA 1996-98), dies of leukemia at 72

2021 Ryszard Grzegorczyk, Polish soccer midfielder (23 caps; Polonia Bytom, RC Lens), dies at 82

Aaron Carter, American singer, rapper and songwriter, accidentally drowns in his bathtub while under the influence of prescription sedatives and non-medicinal inhalants at 34

2022 Bill Treacher, British actor (EastEnders, 1985-96 - "Arthur Fowler"), dies at 92

2022 Peter Kolman,Slovak- Austrian composer (Monumento per 6,000,000), and experimental music proponent, dies at 85

Ryland Davies, Welsh operatic tenor, dies at 80

November 5 Highlights
